lead_paragraph: Utah’s attorney general is using his personal blog to answer criticism that he is wasting state resources by investigating whether the Bowl Championship Series violates federal antitrust laws. The attorney general, Mark Shurtleff, contends that the B.C.S. unfairly puts Utah, and teams in other conferences like the Mountain West that do not get an automatic bid to a B.C.S. bowl, at a competitive and financial disadvantage. For the second time in five years, Utah finished the season undefeated and was shut out of playing in the B.C.S. national title game, which was won by Florida.
